page.title: 06Gotherington Bakery
page.content: The Bakery in Gotherington is seventy to eighty years old.Mr Price has been a baker all his life and he likes his job.There are ten people working there.They start at 2.30a.m. and finish at 2.00p.m.Friday is the bakers busiest day.The bakery uses seven tons of flour each week.They make all their own products.One hundred percent whole meal is the hardest bread to make.The best selling bread is the sandwich loaf.They bake about five thousand rolls aweek and sell them to all the other villages around as well as Gotherington.Their biggest single order has been for one thousand rolls. The most unusual order they have received is for a cake for a dog.They have never had a baking disaster.Mr. Price has not had a holiday for 10 years.Door to door deliveries are becoming rarer due to cost increases.
